snippet: A decline in earnings from premiums and higher disaster losses in its core property and casualty insurance business weighed on the insurer’s results.
abstract: American International Group reports first-quarter net income of $1.61 billion, or $1.09 a share, down 27 percent from $2.2 billion, or $1.49 a share, in year-ago quarter.
lead_paragraph: A decline in earnings from premiums and higher disaster losses in its core property and casualty insurance business weighed on the insurer’s results.

headline.main: A.I.G. Posts 27% Decline in Earnings for First Quarter
headline.print_headline: A.I.G. Posts 27% Decline in Earnings for First Quarter
